snippet: With the threat of Sunni militants looming, various Shiite militias have planted flags and claimed spheres of influence on the 75-mile stretch from Baghdad to Samarra.
abstract: Shiite militias have planted flags and claimed spheres of influence on Iraq's 75-mile stretch from Baghdad to Samarra, where Sunni militants of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria are looming; revered Askariya Shrine in Samarra holds tombs of two Shiite imams, and Shiites have sworn that they will protect it; Sunni militants' goal is to destroy it, as they did in 2006, touching off vicious sectarian bloodletting that lasted into 2008.
lead_paragraph: With the threat of Sunni militants looming, various Shiite militias have planted flags and claimed spheres of influence on the 75-mile stretch from Baghdad to Samarra.

headline.main: On the Road to Samarra, Glimpses of Iraq’s New Fractured Reality
headline.print_headline: On the Road to Samarra, Reading Iraq’s Unwritten Danger Signs

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
